mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Letter, Henry Cherry in Knoxville, Tenn. to Amos Gould in Owosso, Mich., 1865 April 21

mods:mods.mods:abstract: In this letter, dated April 21, 1865, from Henry Cherry in Knoxville, Tenn. to Amos Gould, Cherry describes "the destructed state of the churches divided and impoverished by the war." Discusses a meeting with the "strongly Union" Professor Lamar at Maryville College as well as an upcoming trip to Maryville to preach for "a colony of good industrious Northern men." Asks Gould to write a letter of support for him for the position of State School Superintendent, as "education in Tennessee has lost four years. The cause needs an Agent, or Leader."
